    Posts in order

    • For anything you want to see the notebooks of. Please refer to the repository. Everything will be there. Link on the left.
    • The posts are in the order of newer -> older
    • Format : Date | Title
      TL; DR

    • 30 June 2020 - latex from code

      I want to talk about how to get these beautiful looking latex equations without any effort at all.

    • 30 June 2020 - Loss Functions

      In this post we shall explore as many loss functions as I can find.

    • 27 June 2020 - Implementing Papers

      Notes for papers I read?

    • 27 June 2020 - Book notes -> 100PageMlblook

      I decided to add notes to this blog too. All such notes will be tagged with “book” for easier search. This one is my notes while reading “Andriy Burkov : The Hundred-Page Machine Learning Book”. Amazon. Do support the author if you can.

    • 24 June 2020 - SGD

      In this post we will try to implement SGD and read a bit about what it is.

    • 23 June 2020 - Batching

      Implementing batching for large data. Onehot and data batching. This is a precursor to everything from optimizers to the actual training loop itself.

    • 21 June 2020 - Initialization

      We explore the different initialization techniques that we have and look at papers to see which does better.

    • 20 June 2020 - Linear Model

      Let us start the fun with a simple model which will be extended to fit complex needs.

    • 20 June 2020 - Activation functions

      Activation functions are an extremely important part of any neural network. But they are actually much simpler than we make them out to be. Here are some of them. Lets define a test matrix.

    • 19 June 2020 - Vision

      A roadmap of modules I want to implement. Mostly as a todo list and a help if anyone decides they want to pitch in. (LOL)

    • 19 June 2020 - notebook2script

      I want to convert my work as a script. Selectively.

    • 19 June 2020 - Oversample and Split

      Defining a function to split the dataset into train/test bits and oversample it as well.

    • 19 June 2020 - Dataloader

      The first thing we need is to be able to read data. To begin with, I am starting with the problem of image classification.

    • 19 June 2020 - Initial Steps

      What I started with and how I set up this blog

    • 19 June 2020 - Defining the project and outlining what is to come in the future

      An introduction to what I want to do and why.
